meanings.sent1: The young puppy was so seducible by the tasty treat.
meanings.sent2: She was a seducible target for the con artist's schemes.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the laser pointer's movements seducible and pounced on it playfully.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious stranger's eyes were seducible, drawing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The shiny object was so seducible that even the most disciplined person couldn't resist picking it up.

meanings.definition: Easily enticed or tempted into a sexual relationship.
meanings.sent1: The naive teenager was seducible by the smooth-talking charmer.
meanings.sent2: She was a seducible target for those looking to take advantage of her.
meanings.sent3: The forbidden fruit looked so seducible that Adam couldn't resist taking a bite.
meanings.sent4: The seducible melody of the song lured them onto the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The seducible atmosphere of the dimly lit room heightened their romantic feelings.

meanings.definition: Alluring or attractive in a way that encourages seduction.
meanings.sent1: The seducible perfume drew people in with its enchanting scent.
meanings.sent2: She had a seducible charm that captivated everyone around her.
meanings.sent3: The seducible sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent4: The seducible smile on his face made her heart skip a beat.
meanings.sent5: The seducible beauty of the garden made it a perfect spot for a romantic picnic.
